question.questionName:
Deciding How much testing is enough should take into account:­
i. Level of Risk including Technical and Business product and project risk ii.Project constraints such as time and budget iii.Size of Testing Team iv.Size of the Development Team
question.optionA: i,ii are true and iii,iv are false
question.optionB: i,iv are true and ii is false
question.optionC: i,ii,iii are true and iv is false
question.optionD: ii,iii,iv are true and i is false
question.answer: i,ii are true and iii,iv are false

question.questionName: A test team consistently finds between 90% and 95% of the defects present in the system under test. While the test manager understands that this is a good defect detection percentage for her test team and industry, senior management and executives remain disappointed in the test group, saying that the test team misses too many bugs. Given that the users are generally happy with the system and that the failures which have occurred have generally been low impact, which of the following testing principles is most likely to help the test manager explain to these managers and executives why some defects are likely to be missed
Software testing activities should start:
question.optionA: When the requirements have been formally documented
question.optionB: As soon as possible in the development life cycle.
question.answer: As soon as possible in the development life cycle.

question.questionName: According to the ISTQB Glossary, the word "bug" is synonymous with which of the following:

A company recently purchased a commercial off­ the ­shelf application to automate their bill paying process. They now plan to run an acceptance test again the package prior to putting it into production. Which of the following is their most likely reason for testing?
question.optionB: To gather evidence for a lawsuit
question.optionC: To detect bugs in the application
question.optionD: To build confidence in the application
question.answer: To build confidence in the application

question.questionName:
The following statements relate to activities that are part of the fundamental test process.
(i) Evaluating the testability of requirements. (ii) Repeating testing activities after changes. (iii) Designing the test environment set up. (iv) Developing and prioritizing test cases. (v) Verifying the environment is set up correctly.
Which statement below is TRUE?
question.optionA: (i) and (iii) are part of analysis and design, (ii), (iv) and (v) are part of test implementation and execution.
question.optionB: (i) and (ii) are part of analysis and design, (iii), (iv) and (v) are part of test implementation and execution.
question.optionC: (i) and (v) are part of analysis and design, (ii), (iii) and (iv) are part of testimplementation and execution.
question.optionD: (i) and (iv) are part of analysis and design, (ii), (iii) and (v) are part of test implementation and execution.
question.answer: (i) and (iii) are part of analysis and design, (ii), (iv) and (v) are part of test implementation and execution.

question.questionName: Which list of levels of tester independence is in the correct order, starting with the most independent first?
question.optionA: Tests designed by the author; tests designed by another member of the development team; tests designed by someone from a different company.
question.optionB: Tests designed by someone from a different department within the company; tests designed by the author; tests designed by someone from a different company.
question.optionC: Tests designed by someone from a different company; tests designed by someone from a different department within the company; tests designed by another member of the development team.
question.optionD: Tests designed by someone from a different department within the company; tests designed by someone from a different company; tests designed by the author.
question.answer: Tests designed by someone from a different company; tests designed by someone from a different department within the company; tests designed by another member of the development team.

question.questionName:
Which of the following are aids to good communication and which hinder it?
(i) Try to understand how the other person feels. (ii) Communicate personal feelings, concentrating upon individuals. (iii) Confirm the other person has understood what you have said and vice versa. (iv) Emphasize the common goal of better quality. (v) Each discussion is a battle to be won.
According to the ISTQB Glossary, a risk relates to which of the following?
question.optionC: Negative consequences for the test object.

question.questionName: Which of the following is a fundamental test activity?
Debugging is:
question.optionA: Checking that no unintended consequences have occurred as a result of a fix.
question.optionB: Testing/checking whether the software performs correctly.
question.optionC: Identifying the cause of a defect, repairing the code and checking the fix is correct.
question.optionD: Checking that a previously reported defect has been corrected.
question.answer: Identifying the cause of a defect, repairing the code and checking the fix is correct.

question.questionName: What is a test condition?
question.optionA: A condition or capability needed by a user to solve a problem or achieve an objective that must be met or possessed by a system or system component to satisfy a contract, standard, specification, or other formally imposed document
question.optionB: An item or event of a component or system that could be verified by one or more test
question.optionC: An approach to testing in which test cases are designed based on test objectives and test conditions derived from requirements.
question.optionD: A set of input values, execution preconditions, expected results and execution post conditions.
question.answer: An item or event of a component or system that could be verified by one or more test

question.questionName: When is testing complete?
question.optionA: When there is enough information for sponsors to make an informed decision about release.
question.optionB: When time and budget are exhausted.
question.optionC: When there are no remaining high priority defects outstanding.
question.optionD: When every data combination has been exercised successfully.
question.answer: When there is enough information for sponsors to make an informed decision about release.

question.questionName: The quality and effectiveness of software testing are primarily determined by the quality of the test processes used is stated in:
A programmer is working on code which is very complex. Which of the following is a general testing principle that may affect his work?

A phone ringing in an adjacent cubicle momentarily distracts a programmer, causing him to improperly program the logic that checks the upper boundary of an input variable.Later, during system testing, a tester notices that this variable accepts input values.The improperly coded logic for the upper boundary check is:
Which of the following is not decided in the test planning phase?
The success of testing is not influenced by the Psychological factor:
question.optionA: Gaining confidence about the level of quality and providing information
question.optionB: Clear test objectives determine testers effectiveness
question.optionD: courteous communication and feedback on defects
question.answer: Gaining confidence about the level of quality and providing information

question.questionName: Which of the following is not a quality characteristic listed in ISO 9126 Standard?
Evaluating testability of the requirements and system are a part of which phase:

Component Testing is also called as :
i.Unit Testing ii. Program Testing iii. Module Testing iv. System Component Testing
question.optionA: i,ii,iii are true and iv is false
question.optionC: i,ii,iv are true and iii is false
question.answer: i,ii,iii are true and iv is false

question.questionName:
Regression testing should be performed
v) every week w) after the software has changed x) as often as possible y) when the environment has changed z) when the project manager says
question.optionA: v and w are true, x and z are false
question.optionB: w, x and y are true, v and z are false
question.optionC: w is true, v, x y and z are false
question.optionD: w and y are true, v, x and z are false
question.answer: w and y are true, v, x and z are false

question.questionName: The main focus of acceptance testing is:
question.optionB: ensuring that the system is acceptable to all users
question.optionC: testing by an independent test team

question.questionName: Which of the following is a test type?
Which option best describes objectives for test levels with a life cycle model?
question.optionA: Objectives are dependent on development model for each test level.
question.optionB: Objectives should be generic for all test level.
question.optionC: The objectives of a test level don't need to be defined in advance
question.optionD: Each level has objectives specific to that level
question.answer: Each level has objectives specific to that level

question.questionName: Contract and regulation testing is a part of:
Which of the following is a true statement regarding the process of fixing emergency changes?
question.optionA: There is no time to test the change before it goes live, so only the best developers should do this work and should not involve testers as they slow down the process.
question.optionB: Only retest of the defect actually fixed.
question.optionC: Retest the changed area and then use risk assessment to decide on a reasonable subset of the whole regression test to run in case other parts of the system have been adversely affected.
question.optionD: Always run a full regression test of the whole system in case other parts of the system have been adversely affected
question.answer: Retest the changed area and then use risk assessment to decide on a reasonable subset of the whole regression test to run in case other parts of the system have been adversely affected.

question.questionName: Which of the following is correct?
question.optionA: Impact analysis assesses the effect on the system of a defect found in regression testing.
question.optionB: Impact analysis assesses the effect of a new person joining the regression test team.
question.optionC: Impact analysis assesses whether or not a defect found in regression testing has been fixed correctly
question.optionD: Impact analysis assesses the effect of a change to the system to determine how much regression testing to do
question.answer: Impact analysis assesses the effect of a change to the system to determine how much regression testing to do

question.questionName: Integration testing where no incremental testing takes place prior to all the system’s components being combined to form the system.
To test a function, the programmer has to write a ______, which calls the function and passes it test data
Which of the following statements about component testing is not TRUE
question.optionA: Component testing should be performed by development
question.optionB: Component testing is also known as isolation or module testing
question.optionC: Component testing should have completion criteria planned
question.optionD: Component testing does not involve regression testing
question.answer: Component testing does not involve regression testing

question.questionName:
Integration testing has following characteristics:
I. It can be done in incremental manner II. It is always done after system testing III. It includes functional tests IV. It includes non-functional tests
question.optionA: I, II and III are correct
question.optionC: I, III and IV are correct
question.optionD: I, II and IV are correct
question.answer: I, III and IV are correct

question.questionName: The _______ testing should include operational tests of the new environment as well as of the changed software
____ is also known as Factory acceptance testing.
________ is confirmation by examination and through provision of objective evidence that specified requirements have been fulfilled.
_____ is confirmation by examination and through provision of objective evidence that the requirements for a specific intended use or application have been fulfilled.
_________ is an international standard for software lifecycle processes.
White Box Testing is:
Independent Verification and Validation is:
question.optionD: Done by an Entity Outside the Project’s sphere of influence
question.answer: Done by an Entity Outside the Project’s sphere of influence

question.questionName:
Maintenance testing is triggered by:
1.Modification of system 2.Migration of system 3.Retirement of system
Calculate the cyclomatic complexity of the control flow diagram below:
The principle of Cyclomatic complexity, considering L as edges or links, N as nodes, P as independent paths
What is the main purpose of Informal review?
question.optionB: Inexpensive way to get some benefit.
question.optionD: Discuss, make decisions, solve technical problems.
question.answer: Inexpensive way to get some benefit.

question.questionName:
The Phases of formal review process is mentioned below arrange them in the correct order.
i. Planning ii. Review Meeting iii. Rework iv. Individual Preparations v. Kick Off vi. Follow Up

Which expression best matches the following characteristics or review processes:
1. Led by author 2. Undocumented 3. No management participation 4. Led by a trained moderator or leader 5. Uses entry exit criteria
s) Inspection t) Peer review u) Informal review v) Walkthrough

Success Factors for a review include:
i. Each Review does not have a predefined objective ii. Defects found are welcomed and expressed objectively iii. Management supports a good review process. iv. There is an emphasis on learning and process improvement.
question.optionA: ii,iii,iv are correct and i is incorrect
question.optionB: iii , i , iv is correct and ii is incorrect
question.optionC: i , iii , iv , ii is in correct
question.answer: ii,iii,iv are correct and i is incorrect

question.questionName: What can static analysis NOT find?
question.optionA: The use of a variable before it has been defined

question.questionName: A formal assessment of a work product conducted by one or more qualified independent reviewer to detect defects.
Who should have technical and Business background in reviews?
Who is responsible for documenting all the issues, problems and open point that were identified during the review meeting?
The Planning phase of a formal review includes the following:
Reviewers are also called as:
question.optionD: Both a and b is true
question.answer: Both a and b is true

question.questionName: A peer review that relies on visual examination of documents to detect defects
The Kick Off phase of a formal review includes the following:
question.optionC: Fixing defects found typically done by author

question.questionName:
Defects discovered by static analysis tools include:
i. Variables that are never used. ii. Security vulnerabilities. iii. Programming Standard Violations. iv. Uncalled functions and procedures.
question.optionC: i ,ii, iii is correct and iv is incorrect

question.questionName: Who decides which part of the document has to be reviewed?
Which of the following activities differentiate a walkthrough from a formal review?
question.optionA: A walkthrough does not follow a defined process
question.optionB: For a walkthrough individual preparation by the reviewers is optional
question.optionD: A walkthrough finds the causes of failures, while formal review finds the failures
question.answer: For a walkthrough individual preparation by the reviewers is optional

question.questionName: Which of the following is FALSE?
question.optionA: Dynamic testing and static testing are complementary and find different defects
question.optionB: Reviews are proven to be far more effective with trained participants
question.optionC: Spelling mistakes in are recorded in the reviews but are not discussed.
question.optionD: Static analysis is done after formal review
question.answer: Static analysis is done after formal review

question.questionName: Which one of the following examples describes a typical benefit of static analysis supported by tools?
question.optionA: Static analysis supported by tools may find defects prior to manual test execution.
question.optionB: By using static analysis tools user acceptance testing can be shortened because the users need to execute less tests.
question.optionC: Static analysis supported by tools prevents business analysts and requirement engineers building software models (e.g. state transition diagrams), which do not match the requirements
question.optionD: By performing static analysis of the code supported by tools the need for the developers doing unit testing is decreased.
question.answer: Static analysis supported by tools may find defects prior to manual test execution.

question.questionName: Which of the following statements is NOT correct?
question.optionA: A minimal test set that achieves 100% LCSAJ coverage will also achieve 100% branch coverage.
question.optionB: A minimal test set that achieves 100% path coverage will also achieve 100% statement coverage.
question.optionC: A minimal test set that achieves 100% path coverage will generally detect more faults than one that achieves 100% statement coverage.
question.optionD: A minimal test set that achieves 100% statement coverage will generally detect more faults than one that achieves 100% path coverage.
question.answer: A minimal test set that achieves 100% statement coverage will generally detect more faults than one that achieves 100% path coverage.

question.questionName: Testing throughout the project in a 3 dimensional sense refers to the following dimensions
Code coverage is used as a measure of:

Which testing technique do you prefer in the following situations?
1. Severe time pressure 2. inadequate specification

One of the test goals for the project is to have 100% decision coverage. The following three tests have been executed for the control flow graph shown below.
Test A covers path: A, B, D, E, G. Test B covers path: A, B, D, E, F, G. Test C covers path: A, C, F, C, F, C, F, G
question.optionA: Decision D has not been tested completely
question.optionC: Decision E has not been tested completely.
question.optionD: Decision F has not been tested completely.
question.answer: Decision D has not been tested completely

question.questionName: Exclusive use of white box testing in a test phase will:
question.optionA: ensure the test item is adequately tested
question.optionB: run the risk that requirements are not satisfied
question.optionC: make the need for blackbox testing redundant
question.optionD: suffices for the unit testing phase
question.answer: run the risk that requirements are not satisfied

question.questionName:
Analyze the following procedure:
Ask:What type of ticket do you require, single or return? IF the customer wants 'return' Ask : What rate, Standard or cheap day? IF the customer replies 'Cheap day' Say: That will be $11.20 ELSE Say : That will be $ 19.50 END IF ELSE Say: That will be $ 8.20 END IF
Now decide the number of minimum tests that are needed to ensure that all questions have been asked, all combinations have occurred and all replies given.

A system under development contains complex calculations and decision logic, and it is assessed as high risk because of the relative inexperience of the development team in the application domain. Which of the following would be the MOST appropriate choice of test design technique for component testing?

Pair the correct test design techniques (i to v) with the category of techniques (x, y and z):
i. Exploratory Testing ii. Equivalence Partitioning iii. Decision Testing iv. Use Case Testing
v. Condition coverage x. Specification based y. Structure based z. Experienced based
question.optionA: x = i and ii, y = iii and v, z = iv
question.optionB: x = i, ii and iv, y = v , z = iii
question.optionC: x = ii and iv, y = iii and v, z =i
question.optionD: x = iii and iv, y = v, z = i and ii
question.answer: x = ii and iv, y = iii and v, z =i

question.questionName:
Determine statement coverage and decision coverage for the following:
Pick up and read the newspaper Look at what is on television If there is a program that you are interested in watching then switch the the television on and watch the program Otherwise, Continue reading the newspaper
If there is a crossword in the newspaper then try and complete the crossword

Which two of the following are attributes of structural testing?
a. It is based on testing features described in a functional specification. b. It can include statement and decision testing. c. It can be carried out at all levels of testing. d. It can include debugging.
What does it mean if a set of tests has achieved 90% statement coverage?
question.optionA: 9 out of 10 decision outcomes have been exercised by this set of tests
question.optionB: 9 out of 10 statements have been exercised by this set of tests
question.optionC: 9 out of 10 tests have been run on this set of software
question.optionD: 9 out of 10 requirements statements about the software are correct
question.answer: 9 out of 10 statements have been exercised by this set of tests

question.questionName:
If you are flying with an economy ticket, there is a possibility that you may get upgraded to business class, especially if you hold a gold card in the airline's frequent flier program. If you don't hold a gold card, there is a possibility that you will get 'bumped' off the flight if it is full and you check in late. This is shown in Figure below
Note that each box (i.e. statement) has been numbered.
Three tests have been run: Test 1: Gold card holder who gets upgraded to business class Test 2: Non gold card holder who stays in economy Test 3: A person who is bumped from the flight
What is the statement coverage of these three tests?

Considering the question with the flight check in flow diagram. What additional tests would be needed to achieve 100% decision coverage?
Three tests have been run: Test 1: Gold card holder who gets upgraded to business class Test 2: Non-gold card holder who stays in economy Test 3: A person who is bumped from the flight
question.optionA: A gold card holder who stays in economy and a non gold card holder who gets upgraded to business class
question.optionB: A gold card holder and a non gold card holder who are both upgraded to business class.
question.optionC: gold card holder and a non gold card holder who both stay in economy class.
question.optionD: A gold card holder who is upgraded to business class and a non gold card holder who stays in economy class.
question.answer: A gold card holder who stays in economy and a non gold card holder who gets upgraded to business class

question.questionName:
For the following piece of code, how many test cases are needed to get 100% path coverage?
Procedure X Read (Color) // Input color from user IF (Color == “Red”) THEN Call Roses(Color) ELSEIF (Color == “Blue”) THEN Call Violets(Color) ELSE PRINT “User is no Shakespeare” SaveToDatabase(Color) End Procedure X

You have designed test cases to provide 100% statement and 100% decision coverage for the following fragment of code.
if width > length then biggest_dimension = width else biggest_dimension = length end_if The following has been added to the bottom of the code fragment above. print "Biggest dimension is " & biggest_dimension print "Width: " & width print "Length: " & length
How many more test cases are required?
question.optionA: One more test case will be required for 100 % decision coverage
question.optionB: Two more test cases will be required for 100 % statement coverage, one of which will be used to provide 100% decision coverage.
question.optionC: None, existing test cases can be used.
question.optionD: One more test case will be required for 100" statement coverage
question.answer: None, existing test cases can be used.

question.questionName: One of the following is not a part of white box testing as per BS7925II standards.

Which of the following are most characteristic of structure based testing?
(i) Information about how the software is constructed is used to derive test cases. (ii) Statement coverage and/or decision coverage can be measured for existing test cases. (iii) The knowledge and experience of people are used to derive test cases. (iv) Test cases are derived from a model or specification of the system.

Consider the following pseudo code:
Begin Read Time If Time < 12 Then Print(Time, “am”) Endif If Time > 12 Then Print(Time 12, “pm”) Endif If Time = 12 Then Print (Time, “noon”) Endif End
If the test cases Time = 11 and Time = 15 were input, what level of decision coverage would be achieved?
Which of the following is the component test standard?

Given the following sets of test management terms (v - z), and activity Descriptions (1 - 5), which one of the following best pairs the two sets?
v - Test control w - Test monitoring x - Test estimation y - Incident management z - Configuration control
1 - Calculation of required test resources 2 - Maintenance of record of test results 3 - Reallocation of resources when tests overrun 4 - Report on deviation from test plan. 5 - Tracking of anomalous test results.
What is the difference between a project risk and a product risk?
question.optionA: Project risks are potential failure areas in the software or system; product risks are risks that surround the project’s capability to deliver its objectives.
question.optionB: Project risks are the risks that surround the project’s capability to deliver its objectives; product risks are potential failure areas in the software or system.
question.optionC: Project risks are typically related to supplier issues, organizational factors and technical issues;product risks are typically related to skill and staff shortages.
question.optionD: Project risks are risks that delivered software will not work; product risks are typically related to supplier issues, organizational factors and technical issues.
question.answer: Project risks are the risks that surround the project’s capability to deliver its objectives; product risks are potential failure areas in the software or system.

question.questionName: There are several risks of managing your project's schedule with a statistical reliability model. These include (choose one or more of the following):
question.optionA: Testers spend more energy early in the product trying to find bugs than preparing to do the rest of the project's work more efficiently
question.optionB: Managers might not realize that the testing effort is ineffective, late in the project,because they expect a low rate of bug finding, so the low rate achieved doesn't alarm them.
question.optionC: It can increase the end of project pressure on testers to not find bugs, or to not report bugs.

question.questionName: A project that is in the implementation phase is six weeks behind schedule.The delivery date for the product is four months away. The project is not allowed to slip the delivery date or compromise on the quality standards established for his product. Which of the following actions would bring this project back on schedule?
question.optionA: Eliminate some of the requirements that have not yet been implemented.
question.optionB: Add more engineers to the project to make up for lost work.
question.optionC: Ask the current developers to work overtime until the lost work is recovered.
question.optionD: Hire more software quality assurance personnel.
question.answer: Eliminate some of the requirements that have not yet been implemented.

question.questionName: Stochastic testing using statistical information or operational profiles uses the following method:
question.optionD: Process or standard compliant testing approach

question.questionName: Incidents would not be raised against:
What information need not be included in a test incident report:
Which of the following are false?
question.optionA: An incident can be raised against documentation.
question.optionB: Incidents can be analyzed to assist in test process improvement.
question.optionC: Incidents occur when expected and actual results differ.
question.optionD: Incidents should always be investigated and resolved.
question.answer: Incidents can be analyzed to assist in test process improvement.

question.questionName:
Which of the following is the task of a Test Lead / Leader:
i. Interaction with the Test Tool Vendor to identify best ways to leverage test tool on the project. ii. Write Test Summary Reports based on the information gathered during testing iii. Decide what should be automated , to what degree and how. iv. Create the Test Specifications
question.optionA: i, ii, iii is true and iv is false
question.optionB: ii,iii,iv is true and i is false
question.optionC: i is true and ii,iii,iv are false
question.optionD: iii and iv is correct and i and ii are incorrect
question.answer: i, ii, iii is true and iv is false

question.questionName: Which of the following methods of test estimations rely on information captured from previous projects?
Which of the following could be a disadvantage of independent testing?
question.optionA: Developer and independent testing will overlap and waste resources.
question.optionB: Communication is limited between independent testers and developers.
question.optionC: Developers can lose a sense of responsibility for quality
question.optionD: Independent testers are slow and delay the project schedule.
question.answer: Developers can lose a sense of responsibility for quality

question.questionName: Which of the following is the most important difference between the metrics based approach and the expert based approach to test estimation?
question.optionA: The metrics based approach is more accurate than the expert based approach.
question.optionB: The metrics based approach uses calculations from historical data while the expert based approach relies on team wisdom.
question.optionC: The metrics based approach can be used to verify an estimate created using the expert based approach, but not vice versa.
question.optionD: The expert based approach takes longer than the metrics based approach.
question.answer: The metrics based approach uses calculations from historical data while the expert based approach relies on team wisdom.

question.questionName: Which of the following is a standard for test documentation?

Consider the following list of either product or project risks:
I An incorrect calculation of fees might shortchange the organization. II A vendor might fail to deliver a system component on time. III A defect might allow hackers to gain administrative privileges. IV A skills gap might occur in a new technology used in the system. V A defect prioritization process might overload the development team.
Which of the following statements is true?
question.optionA: I is primarily a product risk and II, III, IV and V are primarily project risks.
question.optionB: II and V are primarily product risks and I, III and V are primarily project risks
question.optionC: I and III are primarily product risks, while II, IV and V are primarily project risks.
question.optionD: III and V are primarily product risks, while I, II and IV are primarily project risks.
question.answer: I and III are primarily product risks, while II, IV and V are primarily project risks.

question.questionName:
A test plan included the following clauses among the exit criteria:
• System test shall continue until all significant product risks have been covered to the extent specified in the product risk analysis document. • System test shall continue until no must fix defects remain against any significant product risks specified in the product risk analysis document.
During test execution, the test team detects 430 must fix defects prior to release and all must fix defects are resolved. After release, the customers find 212 new defects, none of which were detected during testing. This means that only 67% of the important defects were found prior to release, a percentage which is well below average in your industry. You are asked to find the root cause for the high number of field failures. Consider the following list of explanations:
I.Not all the tests planned for the significant product risks were executed.
II.The organization has unrealistic expectations of the percentage of defects that testing can find.
III.A version control issue has resulted in the release of a version of the software that was used during early testing.
IV The product risk analysis failed to identify all the important risks from a customer point of view.
V The product risk analysis was not updated during the project as new information became available.
Which of the following statements indicate which explanations are possible root causes?
question.optionA: II, III and IV are possible explanations, but I and V are not possible
question.optionC: I, IV and V are possible explanations, but II and III are not possible.
question.optionD: Ill, IV and V are possible explanations, but I and II are not possible.
question.answer: I, IV and V are possible explanations, but II and III are not possible.

question.questionName:
As a Test Manager you have the following requirements to be tested: Requirements to test:
R1 Process Anomalies – High Complexity R2 Remote Services – Medium Complexity R3 – Synchronization – Medium Complexity R4 – Confirmation – Medium Complexity R5 Process closures – Low Complexity R6 – Issues – Low Complexity R7 Financial Data – Low Complexity R8 Diagram Data – Low Complexity R9 Changes on user profile – Medium Complexity
Requirements logical dependencies (A >B means that B is dependent on A):
How would you structure the test execution schedule according to the requirement dependencies?

You are a tester in a safety critical software development project. During execution of a test, you find out that one of your expected results was not achieved. You write an incident report about it. What do you consider to be the most important information to include according to the IEEE Std. 829?
question.optionA: Impact, incident description, date and time, your name.
question.optionB: Unique id for the report, special requirements needed
question.optionC: Transmitted items, your name and you’re feeling about the defect source.
question.answer: Impact, incident description, date and time, your name.

question.questionName: Which of the following are typical test exit criteria?
question.optionA: Thoroughness measures, reliability measures, test cost, schedule, state of defect correction and residual risks
question.optionB: Thoroughness measures, reliability measures, degree of tester independence and product completeness.
question.optionC: Thoroughness measures, reliability measures, test cost, time to market and product completeness,availability of testable code.
question.optionD: Time to market, residual defects, tester qualification, degree of tester independence, thoroughness measures and test cost.
question.answer: Thoroughness measures, reliability measures, test cost, schedule, state of defect correction and residual risks

question.questionName: The ISTQB Foundation Syllabus establishes a fundamental test process where test planning occurs early in the project, while test execution occurs at the end. Which of the following elements of the test plan, while specified during test planning, is assessed during test execution?

In a test summary report, the project's test leader makes the following statement, 'The payment processing subsystem fails to accept payments from American Express cardholders, which is considered a mustwork feature for this release.' This statement is likely to be found in which of the following sections?

Some tools are geared more for developer use. For the 5 tools listed, which statement BEST details those for developers
i) Performance testing tools. ii) Coverage measurement tools. iii) Test comparators. iv) Dynamic analysis tools. v) Incident management tools.
question.optionA: i, iii. and iv. are more for developers.
question.optionB: ii. and iv. are more for developers.
question.optionC: ii, iii. and iv. are more for developers.
question.optionD: ii. and iii. are more for developers.
question.answer: ii. and iv. are more for developers.

question.questionName:
Which of the following benefits are MOST likely to be achieved by using test tools?
i) Easy to access information about tests and testing. ii) Reduced maintenance of testware. iii) Easy and cheap to implement. iv) Greater consistency of tests.
Find the mismatch:
question.optionA: Test data preparation tools – Manipulate Data bases
question.optionB: Test design tools – Generate test inputs
question.optionC: Requirement management tools – Enables individual tests to be traceable
question.optionD: Configuration management tools – Check for consistence
question.answer: Configuration management tools – Check for consistence

question.questionName: When a new testing tool is purchased, it should be used first by:
question.optionA: A small team to establish the best way to use the tool
question.optionB: Everyone who may eventually have some use for the tool
question.optionD: The vendor contractor to write the initial scripts
question.answer: A small team to establish the best way to use the tool

question.questionName: Which of the following BEST describes a data driven approach to the use of test execution tools?
question.optionA: Monitoring response times when the system contains a specified amount of data
question.optionB: Manipulation of databases and files to create test data
question.optionC: Using a generic script that reads test input data from a file
question.optionD: Recording test scripts and playing them back
question.answer: Using a generic script that reads test input data from a file

question.questionName:
Which of the following activities would improve how a tool is deployed within an organisation?
a. Defining best practice guidelines for users. b. Roll out the tool across the organisation as quickly as possible to all users. c. Provide technical support to the test team for each type of tool. d. Introduce a system to monitor tool usage and user feedback. e. Ensure that the test process is not changed as result of the tools introduction.

Which of the following activities should be performed during the selection and implementation of a testing tool?
a. Determine whether the organisations existing test process needs to change. b. Conduct a proof of concept. c. Implement the selected tool on a project behind schedule to save time. d. Identify coaching and mentoring requirements for the use of the selected tool

From a Testing perspective, what are the MAIN purposes of Configuration Management?
a. Identifying the version of software under test. b. Controlling the version of testware items. c. Developing new testware items. d. Tracking changes to testware items. e. Analysing the need for new testware items.

Which of the following are characteristic of test management tools?
a. They support traceability of tests to source documents. b. They provide an interface to test execution tools. c. They help to enforce coding standards. d. They manipulate databases and files to set up test data.

Which of the following activities would improve how a tool is deployed within an organisation?
a. Roll out the tool across the organisation as quickly as possible to all users. b. Conduct periodic lessons learnt reviews with tool users. c. Provide technical support to the test team for each type of tool. d. If a tool is not being used, withdraw it and look for an alternative. e. Make sure processes are improved to reflect a new tool.

Which of the following matches the activity (i to iv) to its most suitable type of tool (p to s)?
i. Analysis of code structure. ii. Generation of test cases. iii. Simulation of the environment in which a component is run. iv. Analysis of test metrics.
p. Test management. q. Test design tool. r. Static analysis tool. s. Test harness.
Which of the following tools would you use to detect a memory leak?
Which of the following BEST describes a keyword driven testing approach?
question.optionA: Test input and expected results are stored in a table or spreadsheet, so that a single control script can execute all of the tests in the table
question.optionB: Action words are defined to cover specific interactions in system (e.g., logon entries) which can then be used by testers to build their tests
question.optionC: Keywords are entered into a test harness to obtain predefined test coverage reports
question.optionD: The test basis is searched using keywords to help identify suitable test conditions
question.answer: Action words are defined to cover specific interactions in system (e.g., logon entries) which can then be used by testers to build their tests

question.questionName:
What is the purpose of configuration management in testing?
a. To choose and implement a suitable configuration management tool. b. To identify unique items of testware and their related developed software. c. To provide traceability between items of testware and developed software. d. To enable managers to configure the software. e. To control the versions of software released into the test environment.

Which of the following are benefits and which are risks of using tools to support testing?
1 Overreliance on the tool 2 Greater consistency and repeatability 3 Objective assessment 4 Unrealistic expectations 5 Underestimating the effort required to maintain the test assets generated by the tool 6 Ease of access to information about tests or testing 7 Repetitive work is reduced

From the list below, select the recommended principles for introducing a chosen test tool in an Organization?
1. Roll the tool out to the entire organization at the same time. 2. Start with a pilot project. 3. Adapt and improve processes to fit the use of the tool. 4. Provide training and coaching for new users. 5. Let each team decide their own standard ways of using the tool. 6. Monitor that costs do not exceed initial acquisition cost. 7. Gather lessons learned from all teams.
The _________ may facilitate the testing of components or part of a system by simulating the environment in which the test object will run.
Which tool needs to interface with other office automation software in order to generate reports in the format required by the organization?
Which of the following can be considered as success factors when deploying a new tool in an organization?
question.optionA: Providing coaching to users and defining usage guidelines
question.optionB: Monitoring tool usage and reducing the need for risk analysis
question.optionC: Improving processes and focusing more on component testing
question.optionD: Assessing testing completion and minimizing code reviews
question.answer: Providing coaching to users and defining usage guidelines

question.questionName: What type of tool continuously analyse, verify, and report on usage of specific system resources and give warnings of possible service problems?
Which of the following statements is NOT correct?
question.optionA: A minimal test set that achieves 100% LCSAJ coverage will also achieve 100% branch coverage.
question.optionB: A minimal test set that achieves 100% path coverage will also achieve 100% statement coverage.
question.optionC: A minimal test set that achieves 100% path coverage will generally detect more faults than one that achieves 100% statement coverage.
question.optionD: A minimal test set that achieves 100% statement coverage will generally detect more faults than one that achieves 100% path coverage.
question.answer: A minimal test set that achieves 100% statement coverage will generally detect more faults than one that achieves 100% path coverage.

question.questionName: In the state transition diagram below:
Given the following state transition diagram which of the following series of state transitions contains an INVALID transition which may indicate a fault in the system design?
question.optionA: Login Browse Basket Checkout Basket Checkout Pay Logout.
question.optionB: Login Browse Basket Checkout Pay Logout.
question.optionC: Login Browse Basket Checkout Basket Logout.
question.optionD: Login Browse Basket Browse Basket Checkout Pay Logout
question.answer: Login Browse Basket Checkout Basket Logout.

question.questionName: A candidate attends an exam with 40 questions. To pass, the candidate must answer at least 25 questions correctly. To gain a distinction, a mark of 32 or above must be achieved. Which of these groups of exam scores would fall into three different equivalence classes?

One of the test goals for the project is to have 100% decision coverage. The following three tests have been executed for the control flow graph shown below.
Test A covers path: A, B, D, E, G. Test B covers path: A, B, D, E, F, G. Test C covers path: A, C, F, C, F, C, F, G
question.optionA: Decision D has not been tested completely
question.optionC: Decision E has not been tested completely.
question.optionD: Decision F has not been tested completely.
question.answer: Decision D has not been tested completely

question.questionName: Postal rates for 'light letters' are 25p up to l0g, 35p up to 50g plus an extra l0p for each additional 25g up to l00g. Which test inputs (in grams) would be selected using Boundry value analysis?

A simplified state transition table is being used to model a bank’s ATM login behavior.
Three states have been identified: 1.Waiting for Customer 2.PIN processing 3.ATM Processing.
The following events have been identified (note that some have multiple conditions possible: noted in brackets): Insert Card [Valid and Invalid] Cancel (2 Actions possible: ATM Returns card to customer, ATM Keeps card) Enter PIN [Valid, Invalid] Done (Action: ATM Returns card to customer)
Like most ATMs, inputting the incorrect PIN 3 times causes the ATM to keep the card and output a message that the card can be picked up the next day at the home bank.
For final regression testing, you are required to test to the level of coverage exercising all transitions. Assume that each test case begins at State 1 (Waiting for Customer.) A test case must end when it arrives back at State 1. ATM operation may be cancelled at the PIN processing state or at the ATM Processing state.
Based on the following state transition diagram, what is the minimum number of test cases need to provide this level of

Company ABC is going to provide their employees with a bonus which will be based on the employee’s length of service in the company.
The bonus calculation will be zero if they have been with the company for less than two years, 10% of their salary for more than two but less than five years, and 25% for five to ten years, 35% for ten years or more. The interface will not allow a negative value to be input, but it will allow a zero to be input.
How many equivalence partitions are needed to test the calculation of the bonus?

Consider the following decision table. Given this decision table, what is the expected result for the following test cases?
TC1: A 26 year old on business but with violations or accidents on his driving record. TC2: A 62 year old tourist with a clean driving record.
question.optionA: TC1: Don't supply car; TC2: Supply car with premium charge.
question.optionB: TC1: Supply car with premium charge; TC2: Supply car with no premium charge.
question.optionC: TC1: Don't supply car; TC2: Supply car with no premium charge.
question.optionD: TC1: Supply car with premium charge; TC2: Don't supply car.
question.answer: TC1: Don't supply car; TC2: Supply car with no premium charge.

question.questionName:
Determine statement coverage and decision coverage for the following:
Pick up and read the newspaper Look at what is on television If there is a program that you are interested in watching then switch the the television on and watch the program Otherwise, Continue reading the newspaper If there is a crossword in the newspaper then try and complete the crossword

Consider the following decision table. If you hold an 'over 60s' railcard, you get a 34% discount on whatever ticket you buy. If you are traveling with a child (under 16), you can get a 50% discount on any ticket if you hold a family rail card, otherwise you get a 10% discount. You can only hold one type of rail card.
What is the outcome for these two test cases:
TC1:Rogers with over 60's railway card and a family card travelling alone. TC2: Joe with no railcard, travelling with his 5 year old niece
question.optionA: TC1: Rogers gets 50% Discount; TC2: Joe and his niece get 50% dicount
question.optionB: TC1: Rogers gets 34% Discount; TC2: Joe and his niece get 10% dicount
question.optionC: TC1: Rogers gets 34% Discount; TC2: Joe and his niece get 50% dicount
question.optionD: TC1: Rogers gets 50% Discount; TC2: Joe and his niece get 10% dicount
question.answer: TC1: Rogers gets 34% Discount; TC2: Joe and his niece get 10% dicount

question.questionName:
When choosing which technique to use in a given situation, which factors should be taken into account?
U - previous experience of types of defects found in this or similar systems V - the existing knowledge of the testers W - regulatory standards that apply X - the type of test execution tool that will be used Y - the documentation available Z - previous experience in the development language

If you are flying with an economy ticket, there is a possibility that you may get upgraded to business class, especially if you hold a gold card in the airline's frequent flier program. If you don't hold a gold card, there is a possibility that you will get 'bumped' off the flight if it is full and you check in late. This is shown in Figure below
Note that each box (i.e. statement) has been numbered. Three tests have been run:
Test 1: Gold card holder who gets upgraded to business class Test 2: Non gold card holder who stays in economy Test 3: A person who is bumped from the flight
What is the statement coverage of these three tests?

Considering the diagram with the flight check in flow diagram: What additional tests would be needed to achieve 100% decision coverage?
Three tests have been run: Test 1: Gold card holder who gets upgraded to business class Test 2: Non-gold card holder who stays in economy Test 3: A person who is bumped from the flight
question.optionA: A gold card holder who stays in economy and a non gold card holder who gets upgraded to business class
question.optionB: A gold card holder and a non gold card holder who are both upgraded to business class.
question.optionC: A gold card holder and a non gold card holder who both stay in economy class.
question.optionD: A gold card holder who is upgraded to business class and a non gold card holder who stays in economy class.
question.answer: A gold card holder who stays in economy and a non gold card holder who gets upgraded to business class

question.questionName:
You have designed test cases to provide 100% statement and 100% decision coverage for the following fragment of code.
if width > length then biggest_dimension = width else biggest_dimension = length end_if
The following has been added to the bottom of the code fragment above. print "Biggest dimension is " & biggest_dimension print "Width: " & width print "Length: " & length
How many more test cases are required?
question.optionA: One more test case will be required for 100 % decision coverage
question.optionB: Two more test cases will be required for 100 % statement coverage, one of which will be used to provide 100% decision coverage.
question.optionC: None, existing test cases can be used.
question.optionD: One more test case will be required for 100" statement coverage
question.answer: None, existing test cases can be used.

question.questionName:
For the following piece of code, how many test cases are needed to get 100% path coverage?
Procedure X Read (Color) // Input color from user IF (Color == “Red”) THEN Call Roses(Color) ELSEIF (Color == “Blue”) THEN Call Violets(Color) ELSE PRINT “User is no Shakespeare” SaveToDatabase(Color) End Procedure X
The oracle assumption:
question.optionA: Is that there is some existing system against which test output may be checked.
question.optionB: Is that the tester can routinely identify the correct outcome of a test.
question.optionC: Is that the tester has complete knowledge about the software under test.
question.optionD: Is that the tests are always reviewed.
question.answer: Is that the tester can routinely identify the correct outcome of a test.

question.questionName:
Pair the correct test design techniques (i to v) with the category of techniques (X, Y and Z):
i. Exploratory Testing ii. Equivalence Partitioning iii. Decision Testing iv. Use Case Testing
v. Condition coverage X. Specification based Y. Structure based Z. Experienced based
question.optionA: X=i and ii, Y=iii and v, Z=iv
question.optionB: X= i, ii and iv, Y= v, Z=iii
question.optionC: X= ii and iv, Y=iii and v , Z=i
question.optionD: X = iii and iv, Y= v, Z=i and ii
question.answer: X= ii and iv, Y=iii and v , Z=i

question.questionName: ___________ a document specifying a sequence of actions for the execution of a test. Also known as test script or manual test script.
Which of the following is the component test standard?
